info.title: SiteMinder REST Services
info.description:
# SiteMinder API Wrapper

This API wrapper provides **automatic token management** for SiteMinder REST APIs.
You don't need to handle authentication - the wrapper manages JWT tokens automatically.

## Features
- ✅ Automatic JWT token refresh
- ✅ No authentication headers required
- ✅ Direct pass-through to SiteMinder APIs
- ✅ Full SiteMinder Policy Data API support

## Original SiteMinder API
This wrapper exposes all SiteMinder Policy Data API operations including:
- Policy objects (Agents, Domains, Realms, etc.)
- User Directories
- Authentication schemes
- And more...

**Note:** All authentication is handled by the wrapper. You can call these endpoints directly without providing any Bearer tokens.

get.description: Returns single object which can be of type SmAgent,SmDomain etc... different fields will be returned in the response body depending on the type of object returned.

put.description: Updates an object and returns the newly updated object which can be of type SmAgent,SmDomain etc... different fields will be returned in the response body depending on the type of object returned.

delete.description: Deletes an object and returns empty response.

get.summary: Fetch objects related to this object by name
get.description: Returns objects related to this object which can be of type SmAgent,SmDomain etc... different fields will be returned in the response body depending on the type of object returned.

get.summary: Fetch objects used by this object by name
get.description: Returns objects used by this object which can be of type SmAgent,SmDomain etc... different fields will be returned in the response body depending on the type of object returned.

post.description: Creates a new SmAMRMapping and returns the newly created object.

parameters.name: expanded
parameters.description: return the object while expanding all the objects associated with it as well as all of it's children objects (entire sub-tree of this object).

parameters.name: classinfo
parameters.description: return the meta-data/class information for this object's class. specifies what fields are mandatory, the value's data type, whether it's a list or a single value, etc.

parameters.name: editinfo
parameters.description: same as classinfo, but with the addition of the actual values of the object.

put.description: Updates an SmAMRMapping object and returns the newly updated object.

delete.description: Deletes an SmAMRMapping object and returns empty response.

parameters.description: return the meta-data/class information for this object's class. specifies what fields are mandatory, the value's data type, whether it's a list or a single value, etc.

parameters.name: editinfo
parameters.description: same as classinfo, but with the addition of the actual values of the object.

delete.description: Deletes an SmVariable object and returns empty response.

post.description: Creates a new SmVariableType and returns the newly created object.

error.title: smerror
error.description: the smerror class, returned in the response body when error conditions are encountered. Click on properties for descriptions.

link.description: the link class, represents a link to an object. Click on properties for descriptions.

path.description: The name path to the object

Name.description: The name of the object

Desc.description: A description of the object

Password.description: SmAdmin.Password=(Required if SmAdmin.UserDirectoryLink is not specified.) Specifies the administrator password. SiteMinder stores the password in its directory

DomainsLink.description: Defines the Domain Scope of the administrator

DirectoryAuth.description: Boolean that indicates an externally authenticated administrator

SmAgent.description: Defines an agent object that establishes a Web Agent identity

AgentTypeLink.description: Reference to an agent type object that defines the type of the agent

Name.description: Specifies the name of the agent object

Tags.description: Assign values to the list of tags that are associated with the agent in the format <Tag_id=value>

RealmHintAttrId.description: (RADIUS agents only) A RADIUS attribute that is sent by the RADIUS client device

Desc.description: A description of the object

SmAgent4x.description: Defines a 4.x agent object that establishes a Web Agent identity

IpAddr.description: Specifies the IP address of the server on which the Agent resides

Secret.description: Specifies the secret shared by the agent and the Policy Server

Desc.description: Specifies a description of the Agent Configuration Object

Attributes.description: Name-value pairs that are used to configure an Agent

Name.description: Specifies the name of the Agent Configuration Object
Specifies the name of the agent group object

AgentsLink.description: Specifies the agents in the group

AgentTypeLink.description: Reference to an agent type object that defines the agent type

Desc.description: Specifies a description of the agent group object

AgentGroupsLink.description: Specifies the agent groups in the group

HeartbeatId.description: The GUID of the associated keep-alive agent instance, if any (applies to pre-12.5 agents only)

ProductType.description: Type of Agent like WA, ERP, ASA etc

ProductSubType.description: Type of web server like IIS 6, Apache 1.x, Apache 2.x

AgentIdFile.description: FQN of the configuration file where GUID will be stored

RfcId.description: Specifies the IETF Vendor ID, assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). (Applies to RADIUS devices only.)

Actions.description: A list of operations that this agent type can perform

VendorSpecificBytes.description: The vendor-specific offset provided by the RADIUS vendor. (Applies to RADIUS devices only.) Not a required field

ResourceType.description: The resource type that the agent will protect

Name.description: Specifies the name of the agent type object

Desc.description: Specifies a description of the agent type object

SmAgentTypeAttr.description: Defines an agent type attribute object

AccResponseRadiusBehavior.description: Enumeration indicating how many attributes of this type are allowed for an Accounting Response

DataType.description: One of the enumerated types of data represented by this attribute

RadiusType.description: One of the enumerated types of RADIUS attributes

AuthRequestRadiusBehavior.description: Enumeration indicating how many attributes of this type are allowed for an Authentication Request

AuthAcceptRadiusBehavior.description: Enumeration indicating how many attributes of this type are allowed for an Authentication Accept Response

Id.description: Reference to the agent type attribute object

AuthRejectRadiusBehavior.description: Enumeration indicating how many attributes of this type are allowed for an Authentication Reject Response

Values.description: List of possible values for this attribute

AuthChallengeRadiusBehavior.description: Enumeration indicating how many attributes of this type are allowed for an Authentication Challenge Response

AccRequestRadiusBehavior.description: Enumeration indicating how many attributes of this type are allowed for an Accounting Request

Desc.description: Specifies a description of the agent type attribute object

Name.description: Specifies the name of the agent type attribute object

SmAuthAzMap.description: Defines a directory mapping that lets you authenticate users against one directory and authorize users against another

AzDirLink.description: Specifies the directory against which users will be authorized

AuthDirLink.description: Specifies the directory against which users will be authenticated

AuthAttrName.description: The name of the authentication directory.

AzAttrName.description: The name of the authorization directory

AuthAzMapType.description: The type of mapping between an authentication directory and an authorization directory. The mapping can be based on a DN, a universal identifier, or on an attribute in the directory

AllowAuthLevelOverride.description: If true, the Authentication Scheme will be able to set the Authentication Level value in the user's Session Ticket

Secret.description: The text string to be used as the secret for RADIUS authentication schemes

AllowSaveCreds.description: Specifies whether the scheme is allowed to save user credentials. (X509 Client Cert and Basic scheme only)

PersistSessionVars.description: Specifies that the authentication context data is saved in the session store as session variables. The Policy Server has access to these variables for use in authentication decisions

IsTemplate.description: This scheme object is not to be used directly. It is used as a template to create other schemes

IsUsedbyAdmin.description: Specifies whether the scheme is used for SiteMinder Administrators

Desc.description: A brief description of the authentication scheme

IsRadius.description: specifies whether the authentication scheme supports RADIUS agents

Library.description: The library that the Policy Server uses to process authentication

Param.description: A string which will be processed by the authentication library

Name.description: The name of the authentication scheme

Level.description: A protection level from 1 through 1000. Protection levels provide an additional measure of flexibility in access control

AuthDirName.description: The name of the directory that was used for authentication

ValidateDirLink.description: The name of the directory to use for validation

MappingType.description: An enumeration of the method to use to find the mapped user in the validation directory

SmAzIdentityMappingEntry.description: Defines a mapping (rule) into the target user directory by means of a search criteria for Auth-Authorization mapping

Desc.description: A brief description of the certificate mapping object

IssuerDN.description: The DN of the server certificate

MapToLDAP.description: Specifies how the X.509 client certificate maps to an attribute in the authentication directory

DirType.description: The type of directory used to authenticate users. One of these values: LDAP = 1; Windows = 2; ODBC = 3

LDAPCaDN.description: The DN of the user in CRL Directory

Flags.description: A bit mask that specifies CRL processing behavior

Desc.description: A brief description of the domain object

UserDirectoriesLink.description: Specifies the user directories associated with the domain

Mode.description: A bit mask that defines the purpose of the domain

Tags.description: Assign values to the list of tags that are associated with the domain in the format <Tag_id=value>

IsAffiliate.description: Specifies whether the domain is an affiliate domain

Name.description: The name of the domain object

IsGlobal.description: Specifies whether the policy is global.
Specifies whether the policy link is global.
Specifies whether the response is global.
Specifies whether the response attribute is global.

SmGlobalResponseGroup.description: Defines a global response group object

IsGlobal.description: Specifies whether the response group is global.
Specifies whether the rule is global.

AgentLink.description: Reference to the agent associated with the global rule

IsGlobal.description: Specifies whether the rule group is global.
Specifies whether the user policy is global.
Specifies whether the variable is global.

NewSocketStep.description: The incremental number of TCP/IP sockets that should be opened between an agent and a particular Policy Server process when demand increases

Name.description: The name of the Host Configuration Object

Desc.description: A brief description of the object

MaxSocketsPerPort.description: The maximum number of TCP/IP sockets that can be opened between an agent and a particular Policy Server process

PolicyServer.description: IP address and port information for the Policy Server

MinSocketsPerPort.description: The minimum number of TCP/IP sockets that should be opened between an agent and a particular Policy Server process

RequestTimeout.description: The length of time in seconds that an agent will wait for a response from the Policy Server

EnableFailOver.description: Specifies whether an agent and the Policy Server should communicate through failover or round-robin. The parameter is applicable to non-cluster servers specified in the pServer parameter

FailOverThreshold.description: Specifies the failover threshold percent. The parameter is applicable to the cluster servers specified by SmHostConfig.Clusters

SmIdentityMapping.description: Defines collection of Identity Mapping Entries to represent order of the location of the user in the target user directory

Name.description: Identity mapping name

SmIdentityMappingEntry.description: Defines a mapping (rule) into the target user directory by means of a search criteria

UserSearchExpression.description: list of XPS expressions that define user search criteria

Name.description: Identity mapping entry name

KeyAlgorithm.description: Specifies the RSA algorithm with which a JWT key pair is signed

PublicKey.description: Specifies the public key that is generated for a JWT key pair, to be used for verification

KeyRotationFrequency.description: Specifies the days after which a JWT key pair must be rolled over

StopPastData.description: Specifies the time period in seconds within which the public key of a JWT key pair can be used in a JWKS endpoint, even after the rollover of the JWT key pair

Name.description: Specifies the name for a JWT key pair

PrivateKey.description: Specifies the private key that is generated for a JWT key pair

RolloverKeysNow.description: Specifies that a JWT key pair is immediately rolled over in a PUT operation. Specify true to rollover, or false to avoid rollover.

KeyStrength.description: Specifies the bits of security to be used for generating the new key pair. Specify either 2048 or 4096.

PastPublicKey.description: Specifies the public key of a JWT key pair before its rollover

Description.description: Specifies the brief description of a JWT key pair

PastKid.description: Specifies the unique identifier of a key pair before its rollover

GeneratedTime.description: Indicates the timestamp at which a JWT key pair is generated

Kid.description: Specifies the auto generated unique identifier of a JWT key pair

Name.description: Defines a name for the tag

Category.description:
Define the list of SiteMinder objects that can be associated with the tag. Select one or multiple values from the supported values list in the format
 [ Agent, Domain, FederationEntity, OIDCClient, OIDCProvider, SAML2Partnership ]

Desc.description: Defines a brief description of the tag

SmODBCQuery.description: Defines an ODBC Query Scheme object

QueryGetGroupProp.description: Query that returns the value of a property defined in SmODBCQuery.QueryGetGroupProps

QueryGetObjInfo.description: Query that fetches the class of the object

QueryAuthenticateUser.description: Query that retrieves a password from a user

QueryGetUserProps.description: Query that returns a comma-separated list of user attributes that reside in the same table as the user name

QueryGetGroups.description: Query that retrieves the names of the groups of which the user is a member

QueryIsGroupMember.description: Query that identifies the group membership of a particular user

QueryGetUserProp.description: Query that retrieves the value of a userproperty. The property must be one ofthe properties listed with SmODBCQuery.QueryGetUserProps

QueryLookup.description: Query that returns objects based on an attribute specified in a group table

QuerySetGroupProp.description: Query that sets the value of a group property. The property must be one ofthe properties listed in SmODBCQuery.QueryGetGroupProps

Name.description: The name of the ODBC Query Scheme object

QueryLookupGroup.description: Query that retrieves a group name using an attribute of the group table

QueryLookupUser.description: Query that retrieves a user name using an attribute of the user table

QuerySetPassword.description: Query that changes a user password

QuerySetUserProp.description: Query that sets the value of a user property. The property must be one of the properties listed by SmODBCQuery.QueryGetUserProp

QueryGetGroupProps.description: Query that returns a comma-separated list of group attributes

QueryEnumerate.description: Query that lists the names of user objects in the directory

Desc.description: A brief description of the ODBC Query Scheme object

QueryInitUser.description: Query that determines if a user with a given name exists in the database

PasswordBehavior.description: Bit mask flags expressing the behavior of the password policy.

PWMaxLength.description: The maximum length for user passwords

PWMinLength.description: The minimum length for user passwords

Path.description: Specifies the users to whom the password policy applies. For example, values you can specify include: A complete user DN, or a complete DN of an organization or group containing the users to whom the password policy applies, a search expression that represents the users to whom the password policy applies

LoginMaxFailures.description: Maximum number of failed login attempts a user can make before the user account is disabled

PWMaxRepeatingChar.description: Maximum number of identical characters that can appear consecutively in a password. Minimum number of alphabetic or numeric characters (A-Z, a-z, or 0-9) that a password must contain. May be set in conjunction with PWMinAlpha or PWMinNumbers. For example, if PWMinAlphaNum and PWMinNumbers are set to 4, the password 1234 is valid

PWMinAlphaNum.description: Minimum number of alphabetic or numeric characters (A-Z, a-z, or 0-9) that a password must contain. May be set in conjunction with SmPasswordPolicy.PWMinAlpha or SmPasswordPolicy.PWMinNumbers. For example, if PWMinAlphaNum and PWMinNumbers are set to 4, the password 1234 is valid

Reenablement.description: Specifies the number of minutes a user must wait before attempting to log in again or before the user's account is reenabled. The condition that applies after the reenablement time period is determined by the following flag (which is set through SmPasswordPolicy.PasswordBehavior): Sm_PasswordPolicyBehavior_FullReenable

PwdChangePeriod.description: The maximum period (in days) that a password is valid. After the defined period, a user must change their password

DictionaryName.description: The location of a dictionary file that lists words that cannot be used in a password

PWMinAlpha.description: Minimum number of alphabetic characters (A-Z, a-z) a password must contain

PWMinNonAlpha.description: Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters a password must contain. These characters include punctuation marks and other symbols located on the keyboard, such as "@", "$", and "*"

Active.description: Specifies whether the password policy is active

PWMinNumbers.description: Minimum number of numeric characters (0-9) a password must contain

PWMinPunctuation.description: Minimum number of punctuation marks a password must contain. These characters include periods, commas, exclamation marks, slashes, hyphens, dashes, and other marks used for punctuation

Desc.description: Brief description of the Password Policy object

UserDirectoryLink.description: Reference to the user directory to which the password policy will apply

PWMinNonPrintable.description: Minimum number of non-printable characters that must be in a password. These characters cannot be displayed on a computer screen

Name.description: Name of the Password Policy object

PWReuseCount.description: Number of new passwords that must be used before an old one can be reused

Global.description: Specifies whether the password policy is global

PWReuseDelay.description: Number of days a user must wait before reusing a password

PWPercentDifferent.description: The percentage of characters a new password must contain that differ from characters in the previous password. If the value is set to 100, the new password may contain no characters that were in the previous password, unless SmPasswordPolicy.PWPercentSequence is set to 0

Class.description: Specifies the object class where the password policy applies. Specify the object class as understood by a particular user directory, such as organizational Unit in LDAP

DictionaryPartial.description: The minimum number of letters to qualify for dictionary checking. For example, set this field to 5 to avoid checking words of 4 or fewer characters. Set this field to 0 to reject only passwords that match a word in the dictionary exactly

Resolution.description: A constant that shows how the password policy applies to the users specified in SmPasswordPolicy.Path. For example: If Path is the path to a group, the following constant indicates that the password policy applies to the members of the group: Sm_PolicyResolution_UserGroup. If Path is a search expression that searches for all groups containing a particular attribute, the following constant indicates that the password policy applies to the members of the matching groups: Sm_PolicyResolution_GroupProp. Policy resolution constants are defined in Sm_PolicyResolution_t

LoginMaxInactivity.description: Number of days of inactivity allowed before a user's password expires. The account is not disabled until the user tries to log in after the expiration

ExpiredRedirect.description: This must be the URL of the Password Services CGI

LoginDaysWarning.description: The number of days to warn a user prior to password expiration

PWSpecialsLength.description: Specifies the minimum character sequence to check against the user's personal information. For example, if this value is set to 4, SiteMinder prohibits the use of any four consecutive characters found in the user's personal information, such as the four last digits of the user's telephone number. This field prevents a user from incorporating personal information in a password. SiteMinder checks the password against attributes in the user's directory entry

MaxFailuresRedirect.description: The URL to which the user should be redirected when LoginMaxFailures is exceeded. This must be the URL of the Password Services CGI

Priority.description: Priority of password policy, when multiple password policies apply. The value can be any integer, including a negative one. The higher number has priority over the lower number

PwdChangeDaysGrace.description: Number of days in advance to notify user that the password will expire

PWMinLowerAlpha.description: Minimum number of lowercase alphabetic characters

PWMinUpperAlpha.description: Minimum number of uppercase alphabetic characters

PWPercentSequence.description: Flag that indicates whether to ignore sequence (character position) when the different-from-previous-characters percentage is calculated. To ignore character position, set SmPasswordPolicy.PWPercentSequence to 1. This flag works in conjunction with SmPasswordPolicy.PWPercentDifferent

VariablesLink.description: Linked list of variable OIDs used by this expression

ValidateIdentity.description: Indicates whether users must reauthenticate when requesting access to this resource even if their session is valid

VariableExprString.description: Unique object identifier that corresponds to a variable type

IPAddresses.description: IP addresses that user must use in order to gain access to the resources governed by the policy

ActiveExprString.description: Active expression associated with the policy. The expression is a string of variable definitions in the following format: The non-alphanumeric characters are required characters. For example:<@lib="LibName" func="FuncName" param="FuncParam"@>. In the format example: LibName is the name of the shared library that supports the Active Policy; FuncName is the name of the actual function in the shared library that implements the Active Policy; FuncParam is an optional list of parameters to be passed to the function in the shared library

IsEnabled.description: Specifies whether the policy is enabled

Name.description: The name of the policy object

Desc.description: A brief description of the policy object

ProcessAuthEvents.description: Boolean to trigger this rule in an event of authentication attempts. Authentication event processing affects performance. If no rules in the realm are triggered by authentication events, set this field to false

Desc.description: A brief description of the realm object

ProtectAll.description: Boolean to protect all the resources contained in the new realm

MinUserConfidenceLevel.description: Used for risk calculation during authorization

SessionType.description: Indicates the persistence mode for this realm

AgentLink.description: Reference to the agent associated with the realm

AuthSchemeLink.description: Reference to the authentication scheme associated with the realm

SyncAudit.description: Boolean to enable synchronous auditing. When enabled, users cannot access resources within a realm until their activity has been successfully recorded in the audit logs of both the Policy Server and the Web Agent

ParentRealmLink.description: Reference to the parent realm for a nested realm

Name.description: The name of the realm object.

IdleTimeout.description: Amount of time a user can remain authenticated for the protected resources in the realm without interacting with the resources before they must re-authenticate

AgentGroupLink.description: Reference to the agent group associated with the realm

ProcessAzEvents.description: Boolean to trigger this rule in an event of authorization attempts. Authorization event processing affects performance. If no rules in the realm are triggered by authorization events, set this field to false

SessionDrift.description: The validation period in seconds of a persistent realm

AuthorizationMappingLink.description: Reference to rules for locating users during authorization

MaxTimeout.description: Maximum amount of time a user can access the protected resources in the realm before they must re-authenticate

ValidationMappingLink.description: Reference to rules for locating users during Validation

AzUserDirLink.description: Reference to the directory against which users accessing resources in this realm will be authorized.

SessionAssuranceLink.description: Reference to data intended to avoid session replay attacks

Name.description: The name of the regular expression

NoMatch.description: Indicates whether to match or not match the regular expression

AgentTypeLink.description: Reference to an agent type object that defines the agent type

Name.description: The name of the response object.

Desc.description: A brief description of the response object

AgentTypeAttrLink.description: Reference to the agent type attribute

ActiveExprString.description: A specially formatted string containing a library name, a function and a parameter. For example, <@lib="library.so" func="funcname" param="parm1" @>

TTL.description: Amount of time (in seconds) that can elapse before the value of the response attribute is recalculated

Desc.description: A brief description of the response group

ResponsesLink.description: List of references to response objects

ResponseGroupsLink.description: List of references to response group objects

Name.description: The name of the response group

AgentTypeLink.description: Reference to an agent type object that defines the agent type

SmRootConfig.description: Defines singleton object that contains global settings.

NestedSecurity.description: Usually set to true. Set false for backward compatibility with older policy stores

MajorVersion.description: The policy store major version - read only

MinorVersion.description: The policy store minor version - read only

EnableUserTracking.description: Used for tracking users that have been authenticated via Anonymous Authentication

RegularExpression.description: Flag to perform regular expression pattern matching. Regular expressions are text patterns used for string matching

AllowAccess.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the rule allows or denies access to the resource

ActiveExprString.description: Active expression associated with the rule. The expression is a string of variable definitions in the following format: The non-alphanumeric characters are required characters. For example: <@lib="LibName" func="FuncName" param="FuncParam"@>. In the format example: LibName is the name of the shared library that supports the Active Rule; FuncName is the name of the actual function in the shared library that implements the Active Rule; FuncParam is an optional list of parameters to be passed to the function in the shared library

IsEnabled.description: Flag to enable or disable the rule

Actions.description: The type of action the rule is executing. The supported Web Agent Actions consist of the following HTTP operations: Get, Put, and Post

Desc.description: A brief description of the rule object

Name.description: The name of the rule object

RulesLink.description: List of references to rules in the rule group

Name.description: The name of the rule group object

Desc.description: A description of the rule group object

RuleGroupsLink.description: List of references to rule groups in the rule group

AgentTypeLink.description: Reference to an agent type object that defines the agent type

SmSessionAssurance.description: Contains the configuration information required to prevent session replay attacks

DeviceBinderExpiration.description: Specifies the number of seconds for which the DeviceDNA that is associated with a user remains valid

FlowURL.description: End point from which the DeviceDNA of a user is collected

Name.description: Session Assurance configuration name

RolloverFrequency.description: Specifies the shared secret rollover frequency

RolloverPeriod.description: Specifies the shared secret rollover period

IsEnabled.description: Specifies whether the shared secret policy is active

Name.description: The name of the trusted host object

RolloverEnabled.description: Specifies whether shared secret rollover is enabled for this trusted host

Secret.description: The shared secret of the trusted host

SecretUsedTime.description: The time when the shared secret was last used

IpAddr.description: The IP address of the trusted host

Desc.description: A brief description of the trusted host object

SecretGenTime.description: The time when the shared secret was generated

SearchScope.description: The extent to which SiteMinder looks for users and user groups below SearchRoot in an LDAP directory - all levels below the root (subtree) or just one level below the root. Specify 1 for one level down or 2 for subtree

SearchTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to query an LDAP or custom directory

UserLookupStart.description: The User DN Lookup Start allows users to authenticate by entering only a part of the user name, without having to enter an entire DN string. Identifying unique and non-unique segments of the user DN string does this. Use this field with LDAP directories only

Desc.description: A brief description of the user directory object

SecureConnection.description: Specifies whether the directory is accessed over SSL. Enabling Secure Connect means that SiteMinder performs secure authentication and encrypted transmissions

GuidAttribute.description: Name of the user directory attribute that has been designated as the Universal ID. Typically, the Universal ID differs from the user's login ID, and the Universal ID is used to look up user information. Applies to LDAP, ODBC, and WinNT directories, and possibly to custom directories

PasswordAttribute.description: Name of the user directory attribute that contains the user password, as defined using Password Services. Applies to LDAP and ODBC directories, and possibly to custom directories

EmailAddrAttribute.description: Name of the user directory attribute that contains the user email address

Namespace.description: Designates the specific directory service being connected to (for example, LDAP:, ODBC:, WinNT:, AD:, or Custom:)

RequireCredentials.description: Specifies whether credentials are necessary to authenticate against a user directory

BlobAttribute.description: Name of the binary user directory attribute that is used for storing a user's password history.

SearchResults.description: The maximum number of records that can be returned from a search of an LDAP or custom directory

Server.description: Overloaded parameter whose contents depend upon the namespace: ODBC - Data source name; NT - Domain name; LDAP or AD - An IP address or an IP address and port number in the format IP_address:port_number. The port number 389 is assumed if no port number is specified; Custom - Library name

Username.description: The user name needed to access a user directory

SearchRoot.description: One of the following values: For LDAP directories, the location in the LDAP tree that serves as the starting point for the directory connection-typically, an organization (o) or organizational unit (ou). The Policy Server begins searching at the root when locating a user; For custom directories, any parameters to pass to the custom library

EnableSecurityContext.description: Enables the Windows User Security Context

UserObjectFilter.description: Specifies a string that is a directory-specific class filter. This value is optional and overrides the global setting in the UserClassFilters registry

DisabledAttribute.description: Name of the user directory attribute that SiteMinder uses to keep track of the enabled or disabled state of a user. Applies to LDAP and ODBC directories, and possibly to custom directories

UserObjectClass.description: Specifies a string that is added to any LDAP search filter when searching for a user. This attribute is optional to the directory object

DynamicGroupSearchAttribute.description: Provide the attribute name to be used for dynamic group search in LDAP directories

UserLookupEnd.description: The User DN Lookup End allows users to authenticate by entering only a part of the user name, without having to enter an entire whole DN string. Use this field with LDAP directories only

UniversalIDAttribute.description: Name of the user directory attribute that has been designated as the Universal ID. Typically, the Universal ID differs from the user's login ID, and the Universal ID is used to look up user information. Applies to LDAP, ODBC, and WinNT directories, and possibly to custom directories

ChallengeRespAttribute.description: Name of the user directory attribute that contains a response to return to the user, such as a hint for a forgotten password. Applies to LDAP directories, and possibly to custom directories

UseAdvancedAuthStore.description: Specifies whether Advanced Authentication database connection information is used

Password.description: The password needed to access a user directory

CloseRelatedConnectionOnFailure.description: If this is set to true (default value), all connection handles with the same server name will be terminated when the first communication failure occurs during runtime

PoolSize.description: Defines the number of connection sets to be created for a primary server in each failover group. Enter a value between 1 and 32. Default value is 1

Name.description: The name of the user directory object

SmUserPolicy.description: Defines the users that are bound to a policy

FilterPath.description: The name of the policy object that is being bound to a policy

FilterClass.description: The type of the policy object that is being bound to a policy (group, user, inetorgperson, and so on)

PolicyResolution.description: Describe how one policy object, such as a user, is related to another policy object, such as a group

PolicyFlags.description: Indicates how users should be included or excluded from a policy

UserDirectory.description: Reference to a user directory object

SmValidateIdentityMappingEntry.description: Defines a mapping (rule) into the target user directory by means of a search criteria for Auth-Validate mapping

SourceUserDirectory.description: XPS expression to evaluate source user directory name. The Identity Mapping Entry object is used only if SourceUserDirectory is the same as session user directory

SmVariable.description: Defines a variable object that can be used in a variable expression for a policy or a response. Variable objects are managed by the Variable Functions

Name.description: Defines a variable object that can be used in a variable expression for a policy or a response. Variable objects are managed by the Variable Functions

Desc.description: A brief description of the variable object

VariableTypeLink.description: Reference to a variable type object

Definition.description: Information needed to obtain the value of the variable at runtime

ReturnType.description: The data type of the variable value

SmVariableType.description: Defines a supported variable object type. Variable types are read-only. They cannot be created or deleted through the Policy Management Variable Functions

Desc.description: A brief description of the variable type object

Name.description: The name of the variable type object

timestampskewtime.description: The time in seconds that is used to prevent authentication errors caused by clock skew between token producer and consumer systems

certSerialNumber.description: The required serial number of a certificate

certIssuerName.description: The required issuer name of a certificate

CustomAttributes.description: Defines custom attributes for the Application object

IsAnApplication.description: Differentiates an Application object from a Domain object

EpmRole.description: Defines a user role, which is used to tie users to access policies in an Application object

Name.description: The name of the role, which must be unique within the Application

Expression.description: An expression that defines the role

DLPClassificationList.description: List of classifications allowed by this role

PoliciesLink.description: The policy objects associated with this role
